{{Infobox football biography | name = Aaron Ramsdale | image = | image_size = | caption = | fullname = Aaron Christopher Ramsdale{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/844127 |title=2018/19 Premier League squads confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=3 September 2018 |accessdate=4 September 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1998|5|14|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Stoke on Trent]], [[England]] | height = {{convert|1.88|m|ftin|order=flip}} | position = [[Goalkeeper (association football)|Goalkeeper]] | currentclub = [[AFC Wimbledon]]
(on loan from [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]]) | clubnumber = 35 | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] | youthyears2 = {{0|0000}}–2016 | youthclubs2 = [[Sheffield United F.C. Academy|Sheffield United]] | years1 = 2016–2017 | clubs1 = [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2017– | clubs2 = [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]] | caps2 = 0 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2018 | clubs3 = → [[Chesterfield F.C.|Chesterfield]] (loan) | caps3 = 19 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2019– | clubs4 = → [[AFC Wimbledon]] (loan) | caps4 = 4 | goals4 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2016 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] | nationalcaps1 = 2 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2016–2017 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps2 = 12 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2017– | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] | nationalcaps3 = 3 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2018– | nationalteam4 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps4 = 1 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | medaltemplates = | club-update = 15:13, 3 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 12:32, 5 September 2018 (UTC) }} '''Aaron Christopher Ramsdale''' is an English [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for [[AFC Wimbledon]] on loan from [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]]. ==Club career== Born and raised in [[Chesterton, Staffordshire|Chesterton]], near [[Stoke-on-Trent|Stoke-on-Trent,]] Ramsdale joined [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] but he was released at 15, due to being small at the time.{{cite news|title=AFC Bournemouth: Jussi Jaaskelainen inspired Aaron Ramsdale's rise to the top flight|url=http://www.bournemouthecho.co.uk/sport/15095962.AFC_Bournemouth__Jaaskelainen_inspired_Ramsdale__39_s_rise_to_the_top_flight/|publisher=Bournemouth Echo|date=16 February 2017|accessdate=1 February 2018}} After being released by Bolton Wanderers, he joined [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] in 2013.{{cite web|url=https://www.sufc.co.uk/news/2014/august/development-squad/|title=Development Squad|publisher=Sheffield United F.C.|date=1 August 2014|accessdate=1 February 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180201200046/https://www.sufc.co.uk/news/2014/august/development-squad/|archivedate=1 February 2018|deadurl=no}} After graduating from [[Sheffield United F.C. Academy|Sheffield United's youth academy]], Ramsdale signed a scholarship with the club in May 2014.{{cite web|url=https://www.sufc.co.uk/news/2014/may/welcome-to-the-new-scholars/|title=Welcome to the new scholars|publisher=Sheffield United F.C.|date=8 May 2014|accessdate=1 February 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180201200607/https://www.sufc.co.uk/news/2014/may/welcome-to-the-new-scholars/|archivedate=1 February 2018|deadurl=no}} Ramsdale appeared twice as an unused substitute during the 2015–16 season against [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] and [[Scunthorpe United F.C.|Scunthorpe United]].{{cite news|title=Coventry City 3 – 1 Sheffield United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36118188|publisher=BBC Sport|date=30 April 2016|accessdate=1 February 2018}}
{{cite news|title=Sheffield United 0 – 2 Scunthorpe United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36180664|publisher=BBC Sport|date=8 May 2016|accessdate=1 February 2018}} In May 2016, he signed his first professional contract with the club.{{cite web|url=https://www.sufc.co.uk/news/2016/may/professional-deals-for-youngsters/|title=Professional deals for youngsters|publisher=Sheffield United F.C.|date=6 May 2016|accessdate=1 February 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180201202123/https://www.sufc.co.uk/news/2016/may/professional-deals-for-youngsters/|archivedate=1 February 2018|deadurl=no}} Ramsdale made his professional début starting in a 6–0 home victory over [[Leyton Orient F.C.|Leyton Orient]] in the [[FA Cup]], keeping a clean-sheet in the process.{{cite news|title=Sheffield United: Selfless George Long catches Blades boss Chris Wilder's eye|url=http://www.thestar.co.uk/sport/football/sheffield-united/sheffield-united-selfless-george-long-catches-blades-boss-chris-wilder-s-eye-1-8222245|accessdate=4 December 2016|publisher=Sheffield Star|date=7 November 2016}} He also made another appearance in the FA Cup against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] but lost 3–2.{{cite news|title=Bolton Wanderers 3 – 2 Sheffield United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38120945|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 December 2016|accessdate=1 February 2018}} ===A.F.C. Bournemouth=== On 31 January 2017, he was signed by [[Premier League]] club [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]] for an undisclosed fee believed to be in the region of £800,000.{{cite news|title=AFC Bournemouth sign young 'keeper Aaron Ramsdale from Sheffield United|url=http://www.afcb.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/afc-bournemouth-keeper-aaron-ramsdale-from-sheffield-united-3547589.aspx|date=31 January 2017|accessdate=11 February 2017|publisher=A.F.C. Bournemouth|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170201214616/http://www.afcb.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/afc-bournemouth-keeper-aaron-ramsdale-from-sheffield-united-3547589.aspx|archivedate=1 February 2017|deadurl=yes}} However, the move was reported to cost £1 million.{{cite news|title=Sheffield United: Blades manager Chris Wilder explains why Aaron Ramsdale was allowed to depart|url=https://www.thestar.co.uk/sport/football/sheffield-united/sheffield-united-blades-manager-chris-wilder-explains-why-aaron-ramsdale-was-allowed-to-depart-1-8364033|publisher=The Star|date=1 February 2017|accessdate=1 February 2018}} Ramsdale was on the bench for the final game of the 2016–17 season against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].{{cite news|title=Leicester City 1 – 1 AFC Bournemouth|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39912024|publisher=BBC Sport|date=21 May 2017|accessdate=1 February 2018}} ====Chesterfield (loan)==== In the January transfer window, Ramsdale was loaned out to [[Chesterfield F.C.|Chesterfield]] for the rest of the 2017–18 season.{{cite web|url=https://www.chesterfield-fc.co.uk/news/2018/january/20180105-fourth-new-recruit-joins-spireites/|title=Fourth New Recruit Joins Spireites|publisher=Chesterfield F.C.|date=5 January 2018|accessdate=1 February 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180201212800/https://www.chesterfield-fc.co.uk/news/2018/january/20180105-fourth-new-recruit-joins-spireites/|archivedate=1 February 2018|deadurl=no}} Ramsdale made his Chesterfield debut against [[Accrington Stanley F.C.|Accrington Stanley]] on 6 January 2018, but scored an own goal after he ''"allowed a seemingly harmless [[Kayden Jackson|Jackson]] strike from the right to squirm into the net"'', in a 4–0 loss.{{cite news|title=Accrington Stanley 4 – 0 Chesterfield|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42519872|publisher=BBC Sport|date=6 January 2018|accessdate=1 February 2018}} In a follow-up match against [[Luton Town F.C.|Luton Town]] on 13 January 2018, he kept a clean sheet, in a 2–0 win.{{cite news|title=Chesterfield 2 – 0 Luton Town|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42587767|publisher=BBC Sport|date=13 January 2018|accessdate=1 February 2018}} ====AFC Wimbledon (loan)==== On 4 January 2019, Ramsdale joined [[AFC Wimbledon]] on loan until the end of the 2018–19 season. {{cite web|url=https://www.afcwimbledon.co.uk/news/2019/january/dons-sign-goalkeeper-on-loan-from-bournemouth/|title=Dons sign goalkeeper on loan from Bournemouth|website=www.afcwimbledon.co.uk|date=4 January 2019}} The next day, Ramsdale made his debut for the Dons in a 3–2 Third Round FA Cup victory over [[Fleetwood Town F.C.|Fleetwood Town]] at [[Highbury Stadium (Fleetwood)|Highbury Stadium]]. {{cite web|url=https://www.afcwimbledon.co.uk/news/2019/january/dons-march-into-fourth-round-with-a-dramatic-winner/|title=Dons march into fourth round with a dramatic winner|website=www.afcwimbledon.co.uk|date=5 January 2019}} His league debut came a week later in a 1–1 draw with [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] at the [[Ricoh Arena|Ricoh Arena]]. {{citeweb|url=https://www.afcwimbledon.co.uk/fixtures/first-team/201819/january/coventry-city-vs-afc-wimbledon-on-12-jan-19/#|title=Dons earn a creditable draw at Coventry|website=www.afcwimbledon.co.uk|date=12 January 2019}} ==International career== Ramsdale has represented England at [[England national under-18 football team|Under 18]], [[England national under-19 football team|Under 19]] and [[England national under-20 football team|Under 20]] level.{{cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/england/all-teams/players?p=357107|title=Profile – Aaron Ramdale|work=The Football Association|accessdate=13 March 2017}} He was first called up by England U18 in March 2016, where he made his debut on his debut for the side, in a 4–1 win over [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland U18]] on 27 March 2016.{{cite web|url=https://www.sufc.co.uk/news/2016/march/call-up-for-young-keeper/|title=Call-up for young keeper|publisher=Sheffield United F.C.|date=16 March 2016|accessdate=1 February 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180201202427/https://www.sufc.co.uk/news/2016/march/call-up-for-young-keeper/|archivedate=1 February 2018|deadurl=no}} He went on to make two appearances for the England U18 side. In August 2016, Ramsdale was called up by England U19, where he made his debut on 4 September 2016, in a 1–0 loss against [[Belgium national football team|Belgium U19]].{{cite web|url=https://www.sufc.co.uk/news/2016/august/ramsdale-called-up/|title=Ramsdale called-up|publisher=Sheffield United F.C.|date=24 August 2016|accessdate=1 February 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180201203304/https://www.sufc.co.uk/news/2016/august/ramsdale-called-up/|archivedate=1 February 2018|deadurl=no}} Ramsdale started all five games for the [[England national under-19 football team|England under-19]] side that won the [[2017 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]].{{cite web|title=European Under-19 Championship: England beat Portugal in final|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40619862|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 July 2017|accessdate=9 August 2017}}
{{cite news|title=Chelsea crucial to England winning U19 European Championship – Ramsdale|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/england-u19/story/3158799/chelsea-crucial-to-england-winning-u19-european-championship-aaron-ramsdale|publisher=ESPN|date=16 July 2017|accessdate=1 February 2018}} During the tournament, Ramsdale kept three clean sheets in five matches.{{cite web|url=https://www.afcb.co.uk/news/first-team/ramsdales-england-u19s-make-euros-final|title=RAMSDALE'S ENGLAND U19S MAKE EUROS FINAL|publisher=AFC Bournemouth|date=12 July 2017|accessdate=1 February 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180201205538/https://www.afcb.co.uk/news/first-team/ramsdales-england-u19s-make-euros-final|archivedate=1 February 2018|deadurl=no}} After winning the UEFA European U19-Championship, Ramsdale was called up by England U20 in August 2017, where he made his debut on 4 September 2017, in a 0–0 draw against [[Switzerland national football team|Switerzland U20]].{{cite web|url=https://www.afcb.co.uk/news/club-news/players-set-for-international-action|title=PLAYERS SET FOR INTERNATIONAL ACTION|publisher=AFC Bournemouth|date=29 August 2017|accessdate=1 February 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180201205844/https://www.afcb.co.uk/news/club-news/players-set-for-international-action|archivedate=1 February 2018|deadurl=no}} On 18 May 2018, Ramsdale received a call up to [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]]s for the first time by Manager [[Adrian Boothroyd]], for the [[Toulon Tournament]] with Englands group containing fixtures against [[Qatar national under-20 football team|Qatar U21]]s, China U21s and [[Mexico national under-20 football team|Mexico U21]]s.{{citenews|publisher=FA.COM|date=18 May 2018|accessdate=18 May 2018|title=ENGLAND U21S HEAD TO MAURICE REVELLO TOURNAMENT IN TOULON WITH A 20-MAN SQUAD |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2018/may/18/england-u21s-squad-named-for-toulon-180518}} Ramsdale made his first cap for the England u21 squad on 1st June 2018, playing the full 90 minutes in a 4–0 win against Qatar. ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 2 February 2019}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|League !colspan="2"|[[FA Cup]] !colspan="2"|[[EFL Cup|League Cup]] !colspan="2"|Other !colspan="2"|Total |- season|91150|2016|accessdate=9 January 2018}} |[[EFL League One|League One]] |0||0||2||0||0||0||0||0||2||0 |- |[[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]] |[[2017–18 A.F.C. Bournemouth season|2017–18]]{{soccerbase season|91150|2017|accessdate=9 January 2018}} |[[Premier League]] |0||0||0||0||0||0||colspan="2"|–||0||0 |- |[[Chesterfield F.C.|Chesterfield]] (loan) |[[2017–18 Chesterfield F.C. season|2017–18]] |[[EFL League Two|League Two]] |19||0||0||0||0||0||0||0||19||0 |- |[[AFC Wimbledon|AFC Wimbledon]] |[[2018-19 AFC Wimbledon season|2018–19]]{{soccerbase season|91150|2018|accessdate=6 January 2019}} |[[EFL League One|League One]] |4||0||2||0||0||0||0||0||6||0 |- !colspan="3"|Career total !23!!0!!4!!0!!0!!0!!0!!0!!27!!0 |} {{reflist|group=lower-alpha}} ==Honours== ===International=== ; England U19 * [[UEFA European Under-19 Championship]]: [[2017 UEFA European Under-19 Championship|2017]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{Soccerbase}} {{AFC Wimbledon squad}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ramsdale, Aaron}} [[Category:1998 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Sportspeople from Stoke-on-Trent]] [[Category:English footballers]] [[Category:Association football goalkeepers]] [[Category:Bolton Wanderers F.C. players]] [[Category:Sheffield United F.C. players]] [[Category:A.F.C. Bournemouth players]] [[Category:Chesterfield F.C. players]] [[Category:English Football League players]] [[Category:England youth international footballers]] [[Category:England under-21 international footballers]]
